column2: they can hit a mountain or fly into a dangerous area or not find a place to land. There are generally two types of air navigation depending on weather. In good weather
column3: pilots navigate themselves visually with maps. But when the weather is bad and they do not see the ground
column4: they use special radio navigational instruments or the air traffic controller navigates them. The first kind of navigation is called VFR (visual flight rules) navigation. The second is IFR (instrument flight rules) navigation.Under Visual Flight Rules
